description: The main objective of the project is to develop and install a neurobehavioral facility for blast injury assessment at Canadian Forces Base (CFB) Suffield, Alberta. The project involves the construction of a new facility that will include research laboratories, offices, and other supporting facilities. The facility will be designed to meet the specific needs of the Royal Canadian Dragoons (RCD) and the Canadian Forces. The project will provide a safe and functional environment for the RCD and the Canadian Forces to conduct research and other activities related to the assessment of blast injuries. The project will also provide the necessary infrastructure for the RCD and the Canadian Forces to support their operations and activities in the area.
full_summary:
### RFEOI - Neurobehavioral Facility for Blast Injury Assessment

**Project Background**

The Department of National Defence (DND) is seeking a general contractor to provide all labour, materials, and equipment necessary to build and upgrade the existing 1.8m Blast tube and new research laboratories at CFB Suffield, Alberta. The new Neurobehavioral Facility for Blast Injury Assessment is a non-combustible steel framed building with an offset pitched roof, with a gross floor area of 1840m². The building will accommodate various programs and research activities related to blast injury assessment.

**Scope of Work**

The scope of work includes site grading, safety and security fencing, access roads, and new mechanical and electrical site services. The project requires specialized construction services, including:

* Masonry and full-face concrete block walls
* Steel stud framing and gypsum board interior finishing
* Exterior walls, roofing, and flooring
* Fire suppression systems
* Plumbing and HVAC installation
* Electrical and telecommunication services

**Timeline and Schedule**

The tender phase is expected to begin in mid-November to early December 2024. The project schedule will include the following milestones:

* Substantial completion: 991 calendar days from contract award
* Final completion: 45 calendar days after substantial completion

**Security Requirements**

The contractor and their personnel must meet the security requirements set out in the Canadian Industrial Security Manual, Chapter 8. This includes obtaining a valid Designated Organization Screening (DOS) and having a valid Reliability Status for all personnel requiring access to sensitive areas.

**Contract Award**

Contract award will be based on a competitive bidding process. The contract will be awarded to the lowest bidder who meets the technical requirements and security standards.

**Tender Submission**

Tenders must be submitted electronically through the Merx website. Responses sent by fax, mail, or email will not be accepted. The closing date and time for submission is November 28, 2024, at 16:00 MST.

**Contact Information**

For any questions or clarification, please contact the Contracting Authority, Ryan Pfeifer at (403) 544-4901 or Ryan.Pfeifer@dcc-cdc.gc.ca.
